Vocabularies.Definition: vi.  adapt 适应新的情况；迁就 vt.  容纳，向…提供住处；协调 accommodation n.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She accommodated herself to the new rules.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 美学的；美感的；美的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Some products are chosen for their aesthetic appeal.

Vocabularies.Definition: a., n.  北极（的），北极圈（的）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   There is very little light in winter and very little darkness in summer in the Arctic.
e.g.   The space shuttle Columbia will reenter Earth's atmosphere tomorrow morning.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. of, relating to, or existing in the atmosphere 大气的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   atmospheric pressure

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  that can be reached or achieved 可达到的；可得到的 attain vt.  达到；取得
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   It is unrealistic to believe that perfection is an attainable goal.
e.g.   He acted in accordance with his beliefs.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.,a. 孟加拉人（的）；孟加拉语（的）；孟加拉的
(bound) vt.   tie or fasten; tie together 捆，绑；将…绑在一起
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The criminal bound the woman's hands together behind her back.

Vocabularies.Definition: 动物繁殖的地方 breed (bred) v. bear, produce (young) （使）繁殖；产（后代）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Poverty is a breeding ground for crime.
e.g.   Faced with the threat of a civil war, the President has called for self-control and calm.
e.g.   The cancer has spread to her stomach.
e.g.   Age is not a factor in cataract surgery.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a person or thing committed to the care of another 被照管的人（或事物）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He has charge of the children while his wife is at work.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  fight or struggle (against) （与…）斗争，战斗
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Many politicians emphasized the importance of combating international terrorism.

Vocabularies.Definition: experience, survive or overcome (a difficulty, etc.)    经历；从（…中）活下来（或挺过来）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   It's a miracle that some of the people working in the World Trade Center same through the terrorist attacks.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 有利害关系的事，关心的事；担忧 e.g.   What are your main concerns as a college student?
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   What are your main concerns as a college student?

Vocabularies.Definition: a.   being in disagreement, collision, or opposition 不一致的，冲突的，矛盾 conflict vi.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Our findings conflict with the results of the government's survey.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 国会；立法机关；代表大会
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The President has lost the support of Congress.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. the result or effect of an action or condition 后果，结果
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   An economic crisis may have tremendous consequences for our global security.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  protect from loss or harm; preserve 保护；保存
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   We must conserve water during the drought.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  the act of consuming; the amount consumed 消费（量）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Consumption of oil has risen in recent years.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. current; modern 当代的，现代的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She has worked in both classical and contemporary dance.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   a living being, especially an animal 生物（尤指动物） e.g.   Don't all living creatures have certain rights?
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Don't all living creatures have certain rights?

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  occurring in or existing at the present time 当前的，现在的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   In comparison to the former ones, Coca-Cola's current advertising campaign is more attractive and effective.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  causing or able to cause fatal injury or serious damage 致命的，毁灭性的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Passive smoking can be deadly too.
e.g.   There has been much debate about the cloning of human beings.
e.g.   The election demonstrated democracy in action.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  refuse to grant or allow 不给；不准
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The kid was denied the chance of going to school.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  the state of being dependent 依靠，依赖
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   French doctors tend to regard drug dependence as a form of deep-rooted psychological disorder.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. throw into confusion or disorder 使陷于混乱；干扰
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   An accident has disrupted railway services into and out of the city.
e.g.   It's hard to draw a distinction between popular and serious literature.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. recognize the difference (between) 区别, 辨别
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He is too young to distinguish right from wrong.

Vocabularies.Definition: (abbr.) for example 例如 e.g.   We need helpers of all types, engineers, scientists (e.g. geologists) and teachers.
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   We need helpers of all types, engineers, scientists (e.g. geologists) and teachers.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. of ecology 生态的；生态学的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Large dams may harm ecological balance.
e.g.   The area's ecosystem ranges from rainforest to semi-desert.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.    只能两者择其一的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   You can park on either side of the street.
e.g.   The committee is passing new laws to preserve the environment.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  环境保护论；环境论
n.  more than the reasonable degree or amount 过度，无节制
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Children are not allowed to see the film as there is an excess of violence in it.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. the act or an instance of exploring 勘查，探测；探索
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   We devoted several days to the exploration of the magnificent Maya sites of Copen.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  causing death; bringing ruin 致命的；毁灭性的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The doctor said the patient was suffering from a fatal disease.
e.g.   He expected to spend his life in Italy, but fate had decided otherwise.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. state, condition; basic structure around which sth. is built 状态；框架，构架 frame of mind mental attitude or outlook 心绪；心境
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Lewis was not in the right frame of mind to continue.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  of the basis or foundation of sth. 基本的，根本的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Teaching your children to distinguish right from wrong is one of the fundamental tasks of parenthood.
e.g.   The generator has broken down.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  of humanism or humanists 人本主义的，人文主义的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Religious values can often differ greatly from humanistic morals.

Vocabularies.Definition: to some extent; partly 在某种程度上；部分地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   His failure was due in part to his laziness.

Vocabularies.Definition: for the reason of; using the excuse of 以…为由；以…为借口，以… 的名义
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   They arrested him in the name of the safety of the country.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  杂乱无章的事物；（热带）丛林
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Social security laws and procedure remains a jungle of complex rules.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a single thickness of a material covering a surface 层
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The cake has three layers.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. smaller in amount, value, or importance 较小的，更少的，次要的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Ethiopia, and to a lesser extent, Kenya will be badly affected by the drought.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a means of living 生计
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Fishermen depend on the seas for their livelihood.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 伐木业 log v. cut down, trim, and haul (timber) 砍伐；伐（木）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Logging companies would have to leave the forest before the end of the year.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  以人为中心的，只考虑人类的利益的

Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Birds mate in the spring.

Vocabularies.Definition: v.  cause (a solid) to become liquid （使）融化，（使）熔化
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The ice-cream has melted in the sun.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  not extreme; within sensible limits 适中的；适度的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   A moderate amount of stress can be beneficial.

Vocabularies.Definition: just the same as; only 无异于；只不过，仅仅
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Don't be scared. It is nothing more than a nightmare.

Vocabularies.Definition: for reasons of  因为；以…为理由
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   She is suing the company on the grounds of unfair dismissal.
e.g.   She's interested in the minute organisms in water.
e.g.   The hooting of the owl scared the children.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  something that pollutes 污染物
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Pollutants have contaminated the drinking water sources.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   sth. proposed 提议，建议
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The president is to put forward new proposals for resolving the country's financial crisis.
e.g.   We made him a proposition that he should accept the position.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.  continue with great force; be intense 激烈地进行
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Price inflation still rages although the government has taken some measures to tackle the problem.
e.g.   We must face up to reality and accept that we've failed.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  making or becoming less or smaller 减少
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Many companies have announced dramatic reductions in staff.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   a place providing protection or shelter 庇护所；避难处
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   They took refuge in foreign embassies.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. in spite of everything; anyway 不顾一切地；无论如何
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   His parents objected to his marriage, but he carried on regardless.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.   an official rule or order 规章；规定
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Under pressure from the government, the company obeyed the new safety regulations.
e.g.   There is strong resistance to the plan for a new chemical plant near this area.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  sth. that restricts, such as a law or rule 限制；限制性规定
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The relaxation of travel restrictions means they are free to travel and work.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  absurd 可笑的，荒谬的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   It is ridiculous to spend all her salary buying that so-called antique.

Vocabularies.Word: run/go against the grain (of sth. or to do sth.)
Vocabularies.Definition: run/go against the grain (of sth. or to do sth.) be contrary to one's inclination, desire, or feeling  与（…）格格不入；违反意愿（做某事）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Underhand work of that sort runs against the grain of my will.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. of or characterized by selection 选择的；有选择性的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   I'm very selective about the people I associate with.
e.g.   All animals have the instinct for self-preservation.
e.g.   He has the sensitivity of a writer.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  感情用事的；多愁善感的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Many people have a sentimental attachment to their birth-place.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  多愁善感；感伤主义
vt.   treat or consider in a sentimental way 伤感地对待（或看待）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He's the kind of filmmaker who doesn't hesitate to over sentimentalize women.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad.  in a similar way 同样地，相同地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   He was late and his girlfriend was similarly delayed.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  蜗牛鱼（一种频临绝种的很小的淡水鱼）

Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   His mother regarded with a speculative eye.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.  of the spirit as opposed to matter 精神的；非物质的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Their friendship was strictly spiritual.
e.g.   There have been death threats against the witnesses.

Vocabularies.Definition: to a degree that can be described as 达到…的程度
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   The salesman's manner was abrupt to the point fo rudeness.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. without showing guilt or embarrassment 坦然地，满不在乎地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Here in these areas drugs are sold unashamedly in broad daylight.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 全世界的；普遍的，全体的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Human beings have to face up to the universal threat of pollution.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. calling for immediate attention 紧急的；急迫的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   After the earthquake, there was an urgent need for food and medicines.

Vocabularies.Definition: wv. express one's choice in  favour of (a person or political party) at an election 投票选举voter n.  投票者，（法定）选举人
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   If we can't agree with each other about the plan, let's vote on it.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  the state of being healthy, happy, or prosperous 幸福；福祉
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   His work emphasized the emotional as well as the physical well-being of children.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. wild animals and vegetation, especially animals living in a natural state  （总称）野生动植物（尤指野生动物）
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   People were concerned that pets or wildlife could be affected by the pesticides.

Vocabularies.Definition: manage to reach or go through; make efforts to attain one's goal 设法抵达（或获得通过）；努力达到目标
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.   Rescuers were still working their way to the trapped men.
e.g.   Being competent and learned, he was worshipped by his students.

Vocabularies.Definition: run/go against the grain (of sth. or to do sth.)
